column1: SO #1. Analyze a complex computing problem and to apply principles of computing and other relevant disciplines to identify solutions.
PI #1. Identify an appropriate problem-solving strategy
PI #2. Apply appropriate solution method using principles of computing/other disciplines
PI #3. Test a correct problem solution
SO #2. Design, implement, and evaluate a computing-based solution to meet a given set of computing requirements in the context of the program’s discipline
PI #1. Design an appropriate computing-based solution
PI #2. Implement software/hardware/system applications
PI #3. Evaluate a computing-based solution
SO #3. Communicate effectively in a variety of professional contexts.
PI #1. Communicates effectively in a variety of
professional contexts orally
PI #2. Communicates effectively in a variety of
professional contexts in writing
PI #3. Uses language which appropriate to audience analysis
SO #4. Recognize professional responsibilities and make informed judgments in computing practice based on legal and ethical principles.
PI #1. Recognize/understand professional responsibilities.
PI #2. Understand and apply informed judgements and professional codes of ethics
PI #3. Perform secure computing investigation
SO #5. Function effectively as a member or leader of a team engaged in activities appropriate to the program’s discipline.
PI #1. Understand and participate in creating a project plan as a member or leader of a group.
PI #2. Contribute to the development of a collaborative team environment.
PI #3. Apply principles of computing to implement individual projects.
SO #6. Apply computer science theory and software development fundamentals to produce computing-based solutions.
PI #1. Design software applications to meet specified requirements
PI #2. Apply Software Development Life Cycle for application development
PI #3. Identify appropriate algorithms/systems/architectures for computing-based solutions.
